data.title: Great
data.text: My family has been coming here for years! Good  proportions, fresh ingredients,  great flavors! I've already planned my next visit.

data.title: Food is good
data.text: We've ordered take out at least 3 times and have eaten in the restaurant once and we've only lived here for about 2 months.. Phone in orders only take about 10-15 minutes and it is so good..

data.title: Family owned - the BEST chinese and great service great prices!
data.text: I can walk to this restaurant from where I live. They know me by name! You can call ahead to pick  it up or go in and sit at the table. The Shrimp With Sizzling Rice Soup is the best I have had. It is not too salty. All their dishes are fresh, abundant (if you get the dinner portion), and NO MSG!! It's a family place and has been there for three generation. The food is not greasy. The only non-plus is the quality of their beef. I got that once and not again. Their chicken and pork dishes are great and my husband and I go in and they say, Green Bean Chicken?" Cuz that is what we always get. They have garlic soy sauce mixed and on each table, with chives in it. Yum!!

data.title: ALWAYS GOOD
data.text: The restaurant has a broad selection of Chinese dishes. At lunch, we order from the dinner menu. Our favorite is the Honey Walnut Shrimp--the very best. At times, the waiters forget items and you have to ask again. We do not like that they charge extra for brown rice.

data.title: Best Chinese food in Lake Forest
data.text: Great food and great prices and they always thro in extras, like a free Chinese chicken salad sized according to how much food you ordered, and lots of extra steamed rice. Love dining in or take out!.

data.title: Fast lunch place with average food
data.text: I've been to Din Ho a few times and the food was always good to very good. But I was there recently and they were having a problem with the air conditioner and venting. It started to warm up but we had already ordered. I ordered the shrimp and vegetables. It was rather bland and the sauce that the shrimp were in was gelatinous - weird. My friend had the orange chicken and said it was good. The waiter was not very friendly. He rushed us to order even though it was plain that my friend and I hadn't seen each other in a while and wanted to have a little conversation first. He didn't ask us what kind of soup or rice we wanted. Turns out they were out of brown rice anyway so I guess it didn't matter. But I got hot and sour soup when I prefer egg drop. The service was fast which is a plus when you're on your lunch hour. By the time our meals arrived, the place was getting smoky. By the time we had finished, it was so thick we started coughing and had to leave. Fix the AC! All the smoke from the kitchen was pouring out into the dining area. Food is average Chinese - nothing special but they have a wide variety of dishes so next time I will try something different. But the prices were good with the lunch special at $6.25 and most other dishes ranging from $6.00 to $7.00.

data.title: best chinese takeout food.
data.text: We order takeout from Din Ho once a month,The order is always ready in 10 minutes. The Chicken & scallops is the best. All the others items we've tried are good too.

data.title: Average Thai
data.text: This restaurant we visit twice each year. there chicken fried rice is good for take out and there coconut soup is OK.

data.title: worst restaurant experience of my life (no for real)
data.text:
I ordered take out for sweet and sour chicken. the chicken was soggy, mushy, nasty, bland, and just all around terrible food. when i called to ask for my money back, they argued with me, telling me there is nothing wrong with it. they hung up on me 3 times. finally they said they will give me a refund. 2 minutes later, i get a call back telling me i have to bring the food back. this was the manager. when i asked to speak to the owner, i was told they wernt available, and when i asked when i can speak to them, they threatened to call the police on me, and refused to tell me when the owner is there. 

avoid this place at all costs, i dont leave reviews very often, but i just cant believe what happened here today

data.title: TAKE OUT
data.text: Wife and kid love the place-Always get the same-WALNUT SHRIMP and Mongolian Beef. I think its average but WHAT DO I KNOW?

data.title: Good Chnese.
data.text: Wide selection of dishes to choose from.  The quality of the food never disappoints us.  Our family usually gets take-out to eat at home and when I phone in the order, it is usually ready when I get to the restaurant.

data.title: Wonderful Hometown Chinese Food
data.text: Small, quaint, friendly and efficient service and great food.  Enjoy the Hot and Sour soup, Kung Pao Chicken and Orange Chicken.  The rice is included in the entrees.

data.title: Night out
data.text: It is a nice neighborhood Chinese restaurant. There are many good items to choose from. I like Kung Po beef.

data.title: Terrible
data.text: Don't bother.. The hostess is rude and refuse to answer any questions about the menu. Spend your $$ somewhere else

data.title: Best Chinese in the Area (and maybe all of OC)
data.text: Have only been to the restaurant twice, and still wondering why I do  not go here more often.  The service is very prompt and courteous, and the decor is pleasant.  We had the won ton soup which was just perfect.  Followed up with the honey walnut shrimp and egg foo young.  The shrimp dish is generally too sweet for my liking, but that is really how the dish is to be made - however DIn Ho's rendition was perhaps the best I have had.   In regards to the home made eff foo young, Din Ho creates a nice patty and then puts the generous protein and vegetables on top in a very pleasant sauce.  While I was brought up putting the veggies and protein in the patty itself, I really like the Din Ho take on this dish.  While this restaurant is a bit far from where I live, I will venture here more often as it is really one of my favorites in OC>

data.title: Best Lemon Chicken Ever!
data.text: My husband and I found this place by accident about six years ago and have been regulars ever since.  Pretty much everything that do is delicous!   My favorites are the teriyaki chicken wings and lemon chicken.  Things are no overly breaded as they are in so many Chinese restaurants and the sauces are all so tasty!   Great value and great service.

data.title: Great food, outstanding service, good value.
data.text: The food is always fresh and delicious. You get larger portions than you get at other restaurants. The service is professional but friendly. Our favorite Chinese restaurant.

data.title: We love it
data.text: We found this restaurant about three years ago. We eat here at least once a month. Great food Great service Reasonable pricing

data.title: Not really authentic Chinese food
data.text:
When you see egg FuYoung on the menu, you know that this is not a good Chinese restaurant.  I was a Chinese chef 30+ years ago when I was going to college.  I worked in my relative's restaurant.  We serve egg FuYoung and Chop Chui.  They are not real Chinese food.  You don't find it in Chinese restaurant in China Town or Monterey Park.

I ordered shrimp with oyster sauce.  It was not good at all.  It was way too sweet.  For some reason, they put too much sugar.  The worse thing was- the rice was dry and hard.  It was from the night before.  I normall save those for fried rice when I was a Chinese chef.  You don't serve a day old rice to customers.

If you are looking for real Chinese food, this is not the place.  I ate at the new Shanghai the day before.  it was a little better, but the portion was small.  I write a separate review on that.  

If you want real Chinese food, at least try the restaurants near 99 Ranch Market in Irvine.  Sam Woo is pretty good.

data.title: A Hidden Jewel worth the Drive!
data.text:
This is my favorite American Style Chinese Restaurant that I drive miles out of my way to get to.
Very consistant food and service! ! 

Excellent Mo Su Pork (ask for extra bean sprouts & no cabbage and you are in heaven! ! ! )
